required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Recombinant Human EPO on the Postoperative Neurologic Outcome in Pediatric Moyamoya Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Recombinant Human Erythropoietin on the Postoperative Neurologic Outcome in Pediatric Moyamoya Disease Patients - A Double Blind Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effect of recombinant human erythropoietin (rHuEPO) on the neovascularization of pediatric moyamoya disease patients. rHuEPO will be administrated during perioperative period of the first revascularization surgery. Primary outcome (Incidence of Good postoperative MCA territory revascularization by cerebral angiography) will be evaluated after 3-6 month of revascularization surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of Good postoperative MCA territory revascularization by cerebral angiography (3 grade: good, fair, poor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Short-term postoperative outcome: Incidence and number of the postoperative transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and number of the postoperative transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 1 week (yes or no)

secondary_outcome.measure: Short-term postoperative outcome: Adverse neurologic event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: seizure, increased intracranial pressure, cerebral infarct, hematoma, reoperation (yes or no)

secondary_outcome.measure: Short-term postoperative outcome: Other postoperative complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: e.g. Circulatory failure/arrest, Respiratory failure/arrest, Infection (yes or no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: ICU stay (discharge criteria: Stable V/S + Consciousness)

secondary_outcome.measure: Short-term postoperative outcome: Total hospital stay (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Total hospital stay (discharge criteria: Stable V/S + no progressive Sx)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of rHuEPO on perioperative erythropoiesis: Total intraoperative and perioperative transfusion requirements (mL/kg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Total intraoperative and perioperative transfusion requirements (mL/kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of rHuEPO on perioperative erythropoiesis: Perioperative Hemoglobin, Hematocrit, serum EPO level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Perioperative Hemoglobin, Hematocrit, serum EPO level

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of rHuEPO on perioperative erythropoiesis: GFR, BUN, Creatinine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the 1st postoperative hospital stay, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative 3~6 month neurologic outcome: Clinical outcomes (4 grade): Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outpatient clinical visit, Usually Postoperative 3~6 month, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical outcomes (4 grade): Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative 3~6 month neurologic outcome: Brain Perfusion MRI (2 grade): Favorable, Unfavorable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outpatient clinical visit, Usually Postoperative 3~6 month, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Brain Perfusion MRI (2 grade): Favorable, Unfavorable

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term neurologic outcome: Clinical outcomes (4 grade): Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outpatient clinical visit, Usually Postoperative 12~18 month, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical outcomes (4 grade): Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term neurologic outcome: Brain MRI/A or Brain perfusion MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outpatient clinical visit, Usually Postoperative 12~18 month, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Brain MRI/A or Brain perfusion MRI (2 grade): Favorable, Unfavorable

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term neurologic outcome: Cognitive function assessed by Korean Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children-Ⅳ (K-WISC-Ⅳ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outpatient clinical visit, Usually Postoperative 12~18 month, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive function assessed by Korean Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children-Ⅳ (K-WISC-Ⅳ, has 4 domaines: Verbal Comprehension Index, Perceptual Reasoning Index, Working Memory Index, Processing Speed Index > final score is calculated from T-score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preoperative Cerebral angiography: Suzuki grade, Bilateral involvement
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral angiography: Suzuki grade(1-6), Bilateral involvement (yes/no)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preoperative Brain MRI/A or Brain Perfusion MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: If the preoperative w/u is not completed before recruitment, up to 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Brain MRI/A or Brain Perfusion MRI (2 grade): Favorable, Unfavorable

secondary_outcome.measure: Preoperative Hemoglobin, Hematocrit, serum EPO level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: If the preoperative w/u is not completed before recruitment, up to 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Preoperative Hemoglobin, Hematocrit, serum EPO level

secondary_outcome.time_frame: If the preoperative w/u is not completed before recruitment, up to 1 week

arm_group.description: recombinant human erythropoietin 500 U/kg IVS x 3 times Preoperative day (12-24 hour before surgery) During surgery Postoperative day (12-24 hour after surgery)
Normal saline 50mL x 3 times Preoperative day (12-24 hour before surgery) During surgery Postoperative day (12-24 hour after surgery)

intervention.description: Recombinant human erythropoietin (500 U/kg IVS x 3 times) is administrated to increase the neovascularization after revascularization surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric Moyamoya patients scheduled for the first revascularization surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity or contraindication to rHuEPO
- History of Unstable hypertension, Hypertensive encephalopathy, Thrombosis
- Primary intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH), Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH), Arterio-venous malformation (AVM), Cerebral aneurysm, or cerebral neoplasm
- History of seizure
- Hemoglobin >16 mg/dl
- Prolonged PT (PT > 15.5 seconds, PT INR > 1.2) or Prolonged aPTT (> 40 seconds)
- Thrombocytopenia (platelet count < 100,000/microL), Thrombocytosis (platelet count > 400,000/microL), Neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < 1500/microL)
- Abnormal kidney function (Creatinine> 2.0 mg/dl, History of dialysis)
- Abnormal hepatic function (aspartate transaminase> 80 unit/L, alanine aminotransferase> 80 unit/L)
